measured_by: Social Discounting Task (189 monetary choices across seven social distances)
justification: "All participants then completed a social discounting task during fMRI… participants made 189 decisions separated into 21 randomized social distance blocks… This task has emerged as a particularly good model of altruistic helping."
"All participants did not have any current psychological illness… as assessed by scores above clinical thresholds on the SCL-90."

measured_by: Kaufman Brief Intelligence Test – Second Edition (KBIT-2)
justification: "…matched to altruists on age, gender, and IQ. IQ score was assessed by the Kaufman Brief Intelligence Test -Second Edition (KBIT-2)."

measured_by: Pen-and-paper Emotional Closeness Rating (1–9 Likert scale)
justification: "…administered a pen/paper questionnaire that evaluated their emotional closeness towards each nominated social other… ‘How emotionally close do you feel with this person?’ 1 = Not at all; 9 = Very much."

measured_by: Post-scan Decision Difficulty Rating (1–7 Likert scale)
justification: "Following MRI scanning, all participants rated how difficult each decision they had made was on a scale from 1 (very easy) to 7 (very difficult)."
